Title: Supabase MCP can leak your entire SQL database
Description: In this post, we show how an attacker can exploit Supabase’s MCP integration to leak a developer’s private SQL tables. Model Context Protocol (MCP) has emerged as a standard way for LLMs to interact with external tools. While this unlocks new capabilities, it also introduces new risk surfaces.

Title: .NET and .NET Framework July 2025 servicing releases updates - .NET Blog
Description: A recap of the latest servicing updates for .NET and .NET Framework for July 2025.

Title: Google can now read your WhatsApp messages, here's how to stop it
Description: Google has released a feature that allows Gemini to access third-party apps, such as WhatsApp, even if you've turned off Gemini Apps Activity. Here's how to prevent that from happening.

Title: CTOs Reveal How AI Changed Software Developer Hiring in 2025
Description: We asked 12 CTOs and CEOs what skill they now prioritize when hiring developers because of AI. Their answers validate what experienced developers suspected all along.

Title: GitHub CEO to engineers: 'Smartest' companies will hire more software engineers, not less as… - Times of India
Description: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke suggests that companies leveraging AI effectively will increase developer hiring to capitalize on AI-driven productivity gains. He argues AI serves as a multiplier for engineering talent, making developers more efficient and creating demand for skilled professionals. Dohmke dismisses the idea that AI alone can build successful businesses without substantial coding knowledge.

Title: Stop forcing AI tools on your engineers
Description: What software engineers really need from their managers right now

Title: Behind the scenes of dotnet run app.cs: Exploring the .NET 10 preview - Part 2
Description: In this post I looks at how the new single-file .NET run experience is implemented inside the .NET SDK, focusing on how the virtual-project file is built

Title: Claude Code Thinking Levels: From Think to Ultra-Think
Description:
Claude Code represents Anthropic's first venture into agentic coding tools, available as a command-line interface that transforms how developers tackle complex engineering challenges.

Unlike traditional AI assistants that provide suggestions, Claude Code actively collaborates by reading codebases, editing files, running tests, and even committing changes to repositories.

Description: After just a few months of work, a complete newcomer to the world of sphere packing has solved one of its biggest open problems.
